result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Fong Vue

records.addlTxt: Defense Seeking Extension on Filing Motions; filed and forward to judge for review.

Defense has received discovery and an offer and requests matter be set for final pretrial and jury trial. All final pretrial documents to be filed by the final pretrial hearing. All motions to be filed within 30 days. Any evidentiary matters will be heard on the final pretrial date.
All prior conditions remain the same.

Attorney Mark Emil Kershek in court via zoom, defendant Fong Vue not in court, in custody.  Jack T Eichorst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: STW
CASE HELD VIA ZOOM. Case set for bail/bond hearing. Bail motion by Defense argued and partially GRANTED by the Court.  Cash Bond Set at $7,500.00.   All conditions remain the same. Case adjourned, Branch 38.  Final pre-trial scheduled for December 1, 2022 at 01:15 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for December 12, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Attorney Mark Emil Kershek in court, defendant Fong Vue not in court, in custody.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: STW
CASE HELD OFF TH RECORD. Case set for Bail/bond hearing.   Court in Jury Trial on another matter. Case adjourned, branch 38.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Bail/bond hearing on August 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference on September 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Case assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28 in error. Case has been reassigned to Branch 38, Judge Wagner.
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.  Status conference scheduled for September 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Mark Emil Kershek in court, defendant Fong Vue not in court, in custody.  Samuel Tufford and Jack Eichorst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties appear in person.
Defense counsel has filed a bail motion.
Further, defense counsel advises Court he may be seeking additional testing and requests adjournment.
Discussion with the parties.
Court orders case adjourned for bail hearing and status conference in Branch 28.

Clerk:  jms

Defendant Fong Vue in court with attorney Mark Emil Kershek.  Defendant Fong Vue in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin. PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO. 
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28.   Original Information received and filed.  Copy given to Defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 28.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Adjustment Number: 22A 056309,
Payable Number: 1013729,
Receipt Number: 22RP024346,
Amount: $20.00

Court ordered no contact with AMX (DOB: 8/10/2008) or any unsupervised contact with any child under the age of 16
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Fong Vue in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Fong Vue in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Fong Vue appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rothstein, Branch 25. All parties are notified that effective June 13, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Mark Sanders, Branch 28, in Room 620 of the Safety Building.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL. Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4). 

This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:
